lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's see. We have Laura and Travis coming in hot right now. They'll be here as soon as they can. In the interim, couple announcements, couple fun things. One, there will not be a standard episode of Critical Role next week because me, Taliesin, Marisha, Laura, and Travis will be off in the desert somewhere. Instead, there will be a one-shot being run by none other than the wonderful, illustrious, talented Sam Riegel. His first game of any roleplaying game he's ever DMed before.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I was just learning how to DM from Matt about a minute ago! And I think I know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think you've got this. You want to talk about any of the people who will be playing with you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Look him up on IMDB. He's the voice of everything.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bauza is funny as fuck.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He has never played Dungeons and Dragons before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm legitimately sad that we're gone next week. Just so we can't be in the wings, to watch it in person.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We'll have a lot of road time to watch it on the way back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: With Bauza at the table, any celebrity could show up. He can impersonate anybody. Anybody.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He has about five or six years before he becomes the voiceover industry. The living embodiment of it. Absorbs us like end of Akira. So that's going to be fun. Look forward to that next week. Let's see, what else?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Merch, Laura-- oh.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, there's some stuff in the store!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh man! So many good things!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, go to Geek and Sundry's dot com, whatever the store is!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're going to get the shit beat out of you. She's watching it right now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh. Well, then you're in trouble.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is there a book update? Is there a sticker update? Is there a shirt update?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The mail has found them from where USPS quite literally lost them. I think the distributor found them and now they're bringing some back to the distributor so they can be sent back to us, and then we will be dropping those in the mail.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll be giving those to everyone who was there at Gen Con and signed up. Whatever's left over, we'll get announcements up as to how we can get those to some folks, as well. We've got a process on that one. The Tal'Dorei Campaign Guide went well, apparently, at Gen Con. People seemed to like it. I hope you like it. I know they're pushing hard to get those orders out, all pre-orders, by mid- to late-September. So follow @GreenRoninPub at Twitter for any updates on when those'll be going out. Thank you very much.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We should probably re-announce the art book that we're making. There's an art book that's happening. It's going to hit in the fall, at some point. It's amazing. We've seen it. We've held an approximation of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We've all sobbed silently as we've looked through it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's beautiful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's the phenomenal celebration of everything that you guys have put together around this game and I'm so excited for you guys to see it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It feels like a time capsule, but in a book.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And as long as we're vamping, I've seen some of that comic book, man. It's looking good. It's under the table in my bag. It looks so good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Olivia's done an amazing job, as well. Everyone involved has been great.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's so cute. We love it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think we've stalled all we can stall, right? By the way, the reason Travis and Laura are not here is because we all brought our dice and our little character sheets to Indianapolis, and they left theirs at home, so they drove home to go get it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's important when you've crawled into a mountain's butt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gygax would be proud.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're behind his meniscus, right? Aren't we in his knee?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hip joint.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, real close to the butt, yeah!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right in that sciatic nerve.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bringing it into territory I'm very familiar with right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we do that? Can we find pressure points and take him down with acupressure?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's up to you guys. Oh, and for next week, for Talks, I believe you're doing a special Talks Machina?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're doing something. We're going to fuck around.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't actually know. I'm laser-focused on my shitty one-shot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Brian and I are chatting about it. You'll be naked.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks for tanking the week for us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going to be talking about my favorite book, Hellboy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to be bringing in a bag of Bazooka Joe comics, from the gum.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Inside the Actors Studio style.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you James Lipton in this equation?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, it was Darin De Paul this past week. We're going to switch it up, depending on what the subject matter is. I really want to do a JPL One Night Only, where we bring all the smart scientist dudes from NASA.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sure there are Critters in Space-X.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And then for those who missed it, we announced at the end of One Night Only that there will be a season two of Sagas of Sundry, entitled Madness.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, suddenly I showed up and there's 30 yards of red velvet that I've been begging for.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Boy, let me tell you what I had for lunch today.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're essentially doing an episode of allworknoplay right now. Should we start? Maybe by the time you're done--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think at this point, we need to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will jaeger Pike, Grog, and Vex. It will be fine. "Titties. Let's do it."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you met up with the Hand of Ord.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, everyone was there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh! And we have the rest of our party. Perfect timing. Welcome.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, we'll start from announcements again.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I did a very good job with merchandise.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you? What did you say about merchandise?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He didn't say anything, but he did a great impression of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cool. Sorry about that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A professional is on time, Laura.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It was actually up to me to remember, and I didn't. She was closest to home.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So thank you, Laura. As you all stand on the outside of the opening of this titan ingress, the slick stone steps that break off and crumble into the open expanse where you can plummet hundreds of feet to your death, should you slip. Keyleth is holding the water at bay, keeping the flow from pushing you all back outside of the large earth entity. Gathering your strength, you watch as J'mon Sa Ord's brass dragon form flies just outside of your visual range. You now all stand within this 15-foot-wide entryway. What do you do?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there a passage so we can get out of the flow of the water, once it's been released?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, Keyleth is keeping it at bay for as long as she can concentrate.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If she weren't controlling it, would there still be, even though it's dangerous, some air?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. It may be up to your knees as far as the flow. It's a possible slip, and you're fighting the current to push you outside of the titan.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's concentration up to ten minutes, so let's move quickly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So we're going in? Into the giant?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, it's either that or back out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I still have Pass Without a Trace on us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You haven't lost concentration on it, so I imagine so. What's the marching order, by the way?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll be up front.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, we have Vax up front. Who's next?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll be behind Vax, since we touched down first, I guess.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, Keyleth's after Vax. Who's next?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I will be behind them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Is Trinket still in your necklace?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm bamfing him out right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Trinket is out, next to you. Who's after Vex?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will be lucky Pierre, right in the middle.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pike will walk right in front of Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll be the caboose.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll be between Pike and Grog, right there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With each heavy footfall, you have to catch yourself on the wall as the impact and the shake, the (crashing) of each step of the titan you're within seems to cause you to shift slightly, and a faint bit of dust be released from the tunnel around you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Because we don't know what part of this is the titan's butt and earth, but some of it could have been made by cannibal dwarves at some point, I'm going to assume I'm looking for traps and listening for undead cannibal dwarves.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you're taking a very slow approach.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Actually, that's a good point. Does this look like it was carved by man from cannibal dwarves, or nature-made?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Investigation, or nature check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This would not be a nature check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: My better one? That doesn't count. No, nope. Four total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Much of this tunnel seems to be natural cavern, but there were steps when you first came in. There were stone steps that were carved or placed within the dirt that eventually were consumed or covered by silt and loose earth and whatever the river knocked loose and began to flow over it. So you can see both. A lot of this is natural, but there seem to be, at least in the 30 or 40 feet you've made into the tunnel, you've seen elements of civilization, of crafted entry, that merge with the terrain.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did we get a time frame of how long ago this crypt was built before? How old this crypt has been around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Early Age of Arcanum, so best estimate from what you knew, you guys both learning of the history of this, well over 1,500 years, if not longer.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Before the great war thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beginning of the Age of Arcanum, which was long before the Divergence.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I touch the ground, now that we're in the titan? I'm thinking maybe this might be where the Knuckles are from. Can I touch it and see if the oven mitts do anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Touching it doesn't seem to have any effect or change. The proximity seems to be triggering some sort of harmonization.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I reach up and touch my Adam's apple and (vibrating) this place is crazy. Sorry. No, you wouldn't do it? I thought you would.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so make an investigation check, Vax, as you slowly lead the group up this slightly curving tunnel.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is a 27.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 27, okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't get to sort them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you should do that now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Chaos. Introducing chaos.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys slowly make your way along the path, behind Vax, you look out and occasionally see bits of loose earth that looks looser than most. As you brush it aside, you can see the steps continue. A lot of it's been buried, but this was a staircase that slowly ascended and curved. The movement of the titan seems to have knocked a lot of the loose tunnel to cover it. As you brush it aside, you carefully look about, and you can see that there are occasional symbols of a writing you don't understand, but nothing stands out to you as a trap or a trigger.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it look familiar to any of us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What languages do you guys know?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why are you even looking over here? I know stick figures. I know charades.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do any of you know Dwarven?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can read Dwarven now! You can read now, Grog. You can read four- to five-letter words.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can read Dwarven because of the belt.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But only tiny bits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I might fuck up the bigger pieces.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, as Vax points out some of these symbols, you sit there and concentrate really hard on one of the carvings in the recently uncovered stone step. As you focus, you begin to sound out the sound to yourself repeatedly. (hesitant syllables) You're trying to find the right way to pronounce it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Baa-ram-ewe. Babe, anyone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It takes you about two to three minutes to sound this out, which knocks about two to three minutes off of your concentration time for your Control Water spell. But this looks to be carved in as a warning.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Strangely, if you could have seen Thomara when it was a highly functioning society, they would have been blasting Rammstein everywhere, man.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Speak Rammstein and enter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, these weren't the happy-go-lucky dwarves of old. This was a brutal clan.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It looks like a warning of some kind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rough translation from what you can-- spending about five minutes or so breaking out this glyph and a few other glyphs, it says, "Leave. Death here. No further."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, it says, "Leaves, death here, no further." So leaves, death here, leaves of death here, but no further. I'm still working it out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't want Trinket to die.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks, Scanlan.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like we already knew so much of that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've been working really hard. That was five minutes of the most concentration I've ever given to one thing in my life. Thanks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, let's get up this river before I lose concentration.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You push up another 60 or so feet, Vax still keeping the point man on this. Slowly pulling forward, you begin to hear the sound of rushing water growing louder and louder. You eventually come across the rift in the ceiling that is spilling forth the water that is forming this river. It looks like there is a recent crack and a piece of eroded earth that has fallen out from some sort of water source further up inside the titan that is causing this river to continuously run in and out of this titan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How does this work? How much water could a titan hold?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, this thing is massive.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know, but is there a barrel of water in his chest?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe a lake? An underground lake?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're always impressed by how much water comes out of

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, you guys would be able to move around and continue up past where this opening is, and the river would no longer be impeding your path.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's do that. Keep moving up, right? That's where the city is.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hang on. Can I do a nature check? Is there anything weird about this?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: While she's doing a nature check, I want to do Primeval Awareness and sense undead in the area. Within a mile of me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Within the mile?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Within a mile, which is the entirety of the titan, many. Thousands.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But they're probably in inoperable pieces.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are they all above us or are some near us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing within the very immediate vicinity. Due to the limitations of Primeval Awareness, which does not show you the exact location, you sense the presence and vague direction. Forward and upward, there is this giant mass of undead force that the minute you focus, it causes you to hold your breath. As soon as the impact hits you, you have to remind yourself to exhale.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But maybe they're all hypnotized or something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The structural damage appears to be natural. As you pay attention and watch as another footfall of the titan hits (crashing) and it shakes, you watch as another piece of rock falls and a little of the water flow expands to allow a little more water to exit. You get the sense that, as the titan moves, the longer it travels--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The more it's going to fall apart?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Or at least portions of it that were built into the titan, that aren't part of its natural body--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Start to crumble?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Some of them may.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we Earthquake the titan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To do what?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To fucking fall apart!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But we're in it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but we could take out the entire city.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're in it!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Last time we did that, it kept floating up top.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But it couldn't move for a while.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We have to get to the top. This thing is too big. I don't think my Earthquake will do enough.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's in the grab bag. It's an option.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If we're inside the GI tract of this titan and we give it an Earthquake, is it basically like a big old dead titan fart?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Potentially. It could shit out a lot of dwarven zombies.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It is also an option if we do get overrun.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: True.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you learn it today, Pike?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: "Yeah."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, we're playing Pike?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're playing Pike.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You two?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are. We're the Pike jaegers.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mostly Liam.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can do the impression, and I will sort through the pages.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. As you guys descend past the rushing water, the sound of the river begins to slowly fade behind you as you continue to spiral upward, this slow crawling, ascending tunnel. The dirt that consumes the stairs at your feet eventually begins to give away as your feet find purchase in softer earth from loose gravel and the rocky terrain. As you continue to push further and further into the interior of this titan, you feel another heavy impacting footfall, and all of you have to brace yourself against the nearby wall, this impact seeming heavier than others, and as it does, a number of rocks tumble past.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do you think he just did? Do you think he just fell?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think he swung at something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Another footfall. Every single hit seems to cause the foreign structures on the inside to-- hope that they were made well. Another heavy footfall hits even heavier than the last, and this one, the impact hits so hard that you guys are almost thrown to your knees as you reach out, and you hear this loud crack sound above you. I need Scanlan, Pike, Percival, and Grog to make a dexterity saving throw, please.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Dex, huh?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pike needs to do it too, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Natural 20. Gil coming in in the clutch!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 13 for the other gnome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Everyone but Grog, you glance up just in time to watch as a large piece of the tunnel ceiling dislodges and comes plummeting down in your direction. Grog, you dive out of the way, being clipped off the shoulder, but you manage to avoid most of the impact. The rest of you, however, immediately get buried by rock and broken earth, suffering 29 points of bludgeoning damage to Percival, Pike, and Scanlan. And they are buried and restrained right now, unable to breathe.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I go over and I start-- boulders, dirt, everything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Between all of you guys able to help, it's a negligible period of time, and it wasn't too heavy of an impact. You manage to get them free over the next five or so minutes. They get their breath back. A bit battered, but you get the sense that you should travel quickly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll keep going quickly, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Picking up the pace, you continue up the curvature of the upward ascension. It's probably been about 60 or 70 feet since you've seen any carved portion of terrain, any sign of previous dwarven construct or building or architecture. As the tunnel stops at the curve, it eventually, looking ahead, ascends a bit, about a ten-foot climb up onto a plateau of some kind. You can see some weird root-like tree is growing out of one wall and seems to be dead and petrified in its current space. Do you guys wish to ascend to the plateau?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We probably should, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How far away is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about 40 feet from you right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to creep up 20 feet in front of everybody else.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to go with him. I need to keep an eye out for the zombie dwarves.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Divine Sense, which is specific to undead location, not vague, if there's any within 60 feet. I'll use one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Focusing, no undead within 60 feet of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I drank a tiny little potion of healing. I healed six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good job!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So it's leading up to a plateau?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it goes up about ten or so feet, 15 feet up, and then it leads to another plateau, and you can't see beyond that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to scuttle up and look over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Are you stealthing? Roll a stealth check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Add ten to it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vex, are you going with him or letting him scout ahead?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I crawled up, but then, once he took off again, then I stayed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 41. Okay, cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is what I get to do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It seems new to me every time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You ascend to the top of this plateau. It only goes on for about 15 feet, and then descends down into another chamber that splits in two different directions. A tunnel that goes to the right and to the left. You can see, once again, the stalactites, some of them meeting in the center with the stalagmites to form pillars. You can see portions of the wall that have collapsed and created these soft landslides in one corner to the right of you. But currently, all you see is the descending tunnel and then the split, and you can't see too far one way or the other.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. I turn around to group, and do like a-- And then I go down over, stealthing along the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Anyone else? What are you doing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I guess we follow.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What did this mean? Did this mean we were supposed to follow him and split up?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think that means that there's a split in the path.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's split up, anyway.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Scanlan, you go one way, and we'll go the other.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so as the rest of you ascend to the top of the plateau, you make your way down to the center, and you can see that the path goes to the right and the left. Both seem fairly identical, though they're traveling in opposite directions.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We entered in the left side of the body?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you were to look at it straight on, like it's facing you, it would be the right side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If it's facing us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So our right, its left.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. Its right, our left.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Looking at its butt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you're looking at its butt, to the right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, to the right leg. So if we split, we probably want to keep to the core of it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So go left? To the left.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That is a decision, sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll check, obviously, for air currents.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which point, there is what sounds like an explosion of rock and dirt immediately to the left of Percival as two heavy, rock-like limbs reach out, grab, and pull him against the wall as the ceiling crumples over and collapses. He has now vanished within the wall, and now leaving a pile of rock in his place.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Percy! Keyleth! Keyleth, dig him out!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Darkness. And you're now restrained, and there is no air.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I start clawing at the wall where he was.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You start clawing it. At this point, with the alertness piqued up between you two and Keyleth, you glance around and you can see things emerging out of the nearby walls. Like the rocks themselves are almost pushing through.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I say, get to the middle, stay away from the walls! And I cast Transmute Rock, right in the space where he went, and I reach my hands in and try and grab him out of mud.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it's a 3rd-level spell.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Have you ever transmuted anything before?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've done it once before, and it didn't work very well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're covered in thick, sludgy mud, and as he's pulled out, you guys glance around and you can see, shifting in the darkness, the walls in certain places seem to almost move. I need you all to roll initiative.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're fighting walls! First doors, now walls!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow! We're already at a battle map!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know aquariums that don't look that good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percival, you're pulled into this side there. Keyleth had just pulled you out there. Vex and Trinket.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I would be closer to Percy than Trinket is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's true. You were scrambling at the wall, so that will be Trinket over there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I was, as well. The twins were scrabbling at the rock.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. And that being the case, then, you guys are all clustered up in that platform.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait. Matt, wait.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (robotically) The walk sign is on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as these creatures that are similar to the living earth physicality of the titan and/or the elemental form that Keyleth has taken in the past seem to emerge, but where their once glowing elemental eyes are, there's a vacuous darkness. You feel the rumble of the ground as they shift and glide through the rock in their vicinity.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, they're undead necromantic elemental earth ellies?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're not undead, because you do not sense undead in the presence.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait. Oh no! You guys, guess what we didn't do? We didn't have a feast.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, how were we going to have a feast? We were in a big board meeting and then we came here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So getting initiative orders here. All right, 25 to 20?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Same thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 21 as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jeez. All right. 20 to 15?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. 15 to ten? Ten to five?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pike rolled a one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll say for the purposes of this, you had a torch out, so you could see.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I might have been using my flashlight, I would imagine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does Pike's Mace of Disruption always shed bright light for 20 feet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: When she chooses to. However, as soon as you were pulled into the wall and then dragged back out, and the whole surface of it is coated, you were seeing darkness. In your turn, you are blinded right now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm blinded?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, because you can't see anything around you. All you hear is the moving and shifting of rock and your allies all preparing for some sort of assault.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to spend my turn removing the mud from my eyes, and I think I still have a charge in my flashlight, at this point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can't, though. It is covered in muck and mud.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to spend my bonus action clearing that and then--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll say it'll take your whole turn to clear yourself and to clear the light from that, so there you go. At that point, the light at the front of your weapon lights up, illuminates the vicinity, and you see the moving shadows are bits of rock and stone, moving, living out of the nearby walls.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How do we fight rocks?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm about to tell you. Be careful. They can go into the walls and earth glide, so watch your feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percival, you can move if you want to.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. Is there one right next to me right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's one maybe ten feet from you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to hop over by the little pool fountain. I'm going to back up and get out of this clump of people.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That sounded like you were casting a spell.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're vulnerable to thunder damage, anything vibrate-y, because rocks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which you will find out-- I'll say that you're yelling that as everyone is preparing. That finishes Percival's turn. Grog, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like to rage. I would like to spin around 180 degrees, and I would like to attack Clayface right about there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go for it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit Stain is down at the bottom of the stairs. Reckless!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Great Weapon Master! Assassinate! Uncanny rage!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 28 hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. Oh, I reroll ones and twos. Nice! 22 plus one point of necrotic. 23 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23 points of damage in the first hit. As you spin around, jaw open, growling in rage (yells), you bring the axe across, and it cuts across the front of its chest. You watch as pieces of rock break off, and it still holds strong against the impact.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I do it again!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Reckless, Great Weapon Master this time! 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25 hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 31 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. That end your turn?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is he holding my axe?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's attempting to.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I wanted to move!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, then move.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm moving! I would like to go (counting) 30 feet to face off with this guy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Well, that guy swings at you with his fist as you pull away. You rip the axe out of its grasp, and instead it takes one wide swing with its right fist.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But you slice his fingers off when he does it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is a 24 to hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have a low AC. I don't wear clothes. I wear gauntlets and stuff. I wear skin. And tattoos.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is 18 points of bludgeoning damage, reduced to nine. All right, that finish your turn, Grog? Vex, you're up. And you're on deck, Vax.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to cast Hunter's Mark.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: On the biggest one. This one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then I'm going to shoot him. With sharpshooter!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, okay. Oh no. 19 minus five. 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14 does not hit, unfortunately. As you mark it with your spell, you pull back the first arrow, and it hits, but it ends up exploding, the shards of wood scattering off of it, and your hear a slight (grunts).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, you motherfucker. Okay. 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 misses, just barely. You go to shoot another arrow, this time out of frustration, as you pull back and let it loose, it actually backhands the arrow out of the air, scattering the shaft in the middle of the sky.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, I didn't say sharpshooter! I didn't say sharpshooter on that one, did I? I didn't clarify.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So without the minus five, what would it be?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It would be 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You didn't say it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I should've said it, but I didn't say it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay, we'll let it go. Okay, so roll damage. Regular damage. So as it goes to backhand it out of the air, the arrow manages to sink in the center of its fist. It still causes a crack to widen across the various plates that keep its left arm together.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 16 plus five lightning damage. And then, since he is next to Scanlan, I get sneak attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, 12. 15 sneak attack! And then Hunter's Mark, three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So the second one, as it hits, it causes this rift in the center of its large, battering ram-like arm to shift and crack and pieces of broken shale peel and fall off to the ground around it. Does that end your turn?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you want to move, or do you want to stay where you are?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to stay where I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vax, you're up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We've been in here under an hour. Probably not much time left, but under an hour, right? Since we arrived?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pushing close to an hour.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. How high is the ceiling in this tunnel?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About 12 feet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Probably between Percy and Pike, if we can manage it. And I'm going to dagger, dagger, dagger, with sharpshooter on all three, the one right below me next to Keyleth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. The first one is a 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, that hits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Second one is balls. And the third one is... 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20 hits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And because assassin and they haven't gone yet-- oh, I have advantage because of assassin, so sneak attack. Also next to Keyleth. Multiple reasons for sneak attack, so that is 11, plus psychic damage is 15. (counting) 36 for the first one. And then the last one does a rinky-dink one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One point of damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Because off-hand attack doesn't get any--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's no modifier, just whatever damage the weapon would deal.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, just one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I'll stay floating.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So as you're flying there, your wings still--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't you add six, though?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No modifier. That's the modifier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No dexterity modifier. It still gets weapon bonus, damage bonus on the weapon.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's calculated from dexterity. Oh, so two. And 20 more for the sharpshooter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of them seem to wedge and break the interior of its chest, and you watch as parts of its body are falling off in chunks. It's giving this horrible sucking sound, like it's barely holding itself together. (wheezes) But there it still stands. That ends your turn. Scanlan, you're up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I will rotate around the guy with the red ring around him so that I'm between him and his friend.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right there, you mean? Okay, you're right on the edge. There's a platform drop-off behind you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (singing) I'm living on the edge! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you rush over there, you're like (grunts). You watch as a couple rocks tumble off and clatter below. Ten-foot drop; not too bad.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. Oh. I'll inspire Grog first. Because I'm about to hit you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will sing, (singing) Hey now! You're a Grog-star. Get your axe up and slay! Hey now! You're a Grog-star. Get your rage on and rage! All Laura's dice are gold. Now a d12 can be rolled.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pulled that shit out at the last minute.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It came back around. All right, so take your inspiration dice, definitely.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And then I'll do a 3rd-level Thunderwave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Towards which one?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Both. It's 15 feet from me. Yeah, it's from me in a 15-foot cube.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A cube? Okay, so you can put yourself in the cube, then. Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You may not even hit Grog, necessarily.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You'd better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can do it where it doesn't hit Grog. It just hits the other guy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That'll be nice!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so that's a constitution saving throw for both of them, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, sure. Oh shit. Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rolled a natural 20 on its saving throw. The first one rolled a five.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What did the second one roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh fuck. Okay, that does. They both take 4d8 damage, and the one who didn't make his save gets pushed away, but he's right up against the wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So it doesn't do anything. However, it does thunder damage, which they are vulnerable to, so they take double damage from this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Double damage?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as the blast of thunder energy slams outward. Both of them, you watch as their bodies are thrown into the rock behind them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Terrible! 12 points.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was subpar.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay. Both of them get hit and thrown back, slam into the wall, and you watch as their body is unable to earthglide based on the force of the impact, so it actually causes part of their body to crack intrinsically. And they both fall back to the ground, and their feet sink into the stone about an inch or two. And they reposition their stance. All right. Anything else you want to do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh shit, if I move away, he's going to take a swing at me, isn't he? But that would be wise.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your call.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I'll shelter in place.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Now it's their turn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They're going to come out asking for help, because they've been--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We've been stuck in his digestive tract!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And we're slaughtering them! We weren't going to even say anything or do anything to you guys!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First off, I need Keyleth, Vex, and Percival to make a dexterity saving throw, please.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural 20!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was so close to being a natural 20!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not natural 20, but a 20 nonetheless.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. What did you get?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What, you're sucked in the ground? No!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The ground raised up?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did they turn us to stone? What did they do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. Keyleth, you all of a sudden watch as the one behind you that is barely holding on angrily goes (impact) slams its fist into the ground. And from the sudden vibration, the earth seems to rise up underneath and attempt to swallow you. Vex and Percival, you both grab each other's hands and leap into the air, and it passes under your feet. However, Keyleth is not fast enough and gets swallowed as it closes up (crash) around her, and now there's a giant pile of earth and rock where Keyleth is buried within and restrained. You both manage to move out of the way.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: These guys are going to move up there. And this guy's going to move up here. This guy's going to attempt to pummel the shit out of Scanlan. He's going to make two slam attacks against you. That is a 20 and a 21.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take 16 points of bludgeoning damage and 17 points of bludgeoning damage. And you watch as it slips into the wall and vanishes. You can make an attack of opportunity against it. However, I am giving it three-quarters cover, as it pulls just out of melee range and is mostly in the wall, so it gets plus five to armor class.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will swing my sword at it with advantage, because I just inspired someone, and Mythcarver has that feature. The first one was better. 17 plus ten!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That actually hits! Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mythcarver gets you some action once every two years.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I actually don't know. It says it's a plus-three longsword. Does that mean it's 1d8 plus three?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 1d8 plus three plus your strength modifier.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So it's 1d8 plus four. And then I rolled a one, so that's five. But it also says, somewhere in here, deals an additional 1d6 force damage! Oh yeah! One.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is a 28 and a 19.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Dang, Perce.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 points of bludgeoning damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. And 15 points of bludgeoning damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shit! On a retreating enemy, I get to cast a spell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: War caster. Well, next time. That's against you and against Vex. That is a 22?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh wait, that's Pike. Hold on. Yes, it hits me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And 21.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My armor class is 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So it still hits you, all right. You take 14 points of bludgeoning damage, and another 14 points of bludgeoning damage. And then both of these guys--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do we get an attack of opportunity?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do. With a plus five to AC as this guy sinks into the ground.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we shoot him with an arrow as he sinks into the ground?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's a melee attack.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So I'm going to take a swing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That hits. Actually, I crit only with my guns on a 19, right? I don't crit with my sword?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm pretty sure you crit on a 19 or 20 regardless, but the hemorrhaging shot element doesn't happen.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I crit, so that's a ridiculous thing to hit. 32 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that hits.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So that's a 1d8.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You never know, that guy could be made out of concrete.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Two plus seven, and it's silvered, if that matters. That's 16 points of piercing damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, cool. So you strike out as it disappears into the wall and vanishes. This guy here shifts into the wall as well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He vanished?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, he (sucking sound) into the wall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're all vanishing!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, not this guy, they're still walking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And the guy who's right there is going to take two strikes at you, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, bring it. They both hit. They're reckless.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. Yep. And the other attack-- Yep, both hit. So that's 16 points of bludgeoning damage, reduced to eight. And 12 points of bludgeoning damage, reduced to six.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Six. Can I take my retaliation strike against him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on. Natural 20!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, that's going to suck!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Squish him! Make a building out of him! I don't know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh! I reroll ones and twos! Great. 11, that's better.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You get all sorts of bonuses to that crit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Now I've got David Bowie in my head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 48 points of damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, necrotic. 52.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is that doubled? And you doubled everything into your extra crit--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've been practicing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it slams with both fists into you, with one giant (whoosh) over the head as it impacts you, you grab with one hand the back of its fist and grin, and then bring the axe straight up into its torso with one hand. It strikes and splits open part of its rock chest and you hear this (guttural wheeze) which it reforms again. But still, it's taken the brunt of the impact, and it's now going to shift into the wall, which you can't attack because you already used your reaction. That ends their turn. Keyleth, you're up. You're currently buried. You're blinded.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (thud) And now that I'm earth elemental, I have tremor sense. Can I sense where these other motherfuckers are?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can feel where they are, yeah. You can sense them moving through the ground.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh shit. Everybody dies.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But I want to be underground. I'm there, but I'm still underground right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. I'm marking your place.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (singing) Underground!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (singing) Put on your earthglide shoes and dance! (speaking) Okay, I want to go right in the center of as many of them as I can hit and take a cue from Scanlan and do a Thunderwave underground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As your earth elemental? Because you have--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because I can cast in Wild Shape now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's going to the phone. He's checking his texts.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So if they're healing when we hit them, do we think they're healing when they go back into the wall?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Probably.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let me see here real fast. What are the components of Thunderwave?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will look for you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thunderwave is verbal and somatic. Right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: V, S!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Dude, that is a badass.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're probably still good. Let me see.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not using material components, you mean?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He got bigger?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, that's me. That's me, baby, that's me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Should've seen the green.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, verbal and somatic, so you can do that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to do it 3rd-level, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15-foot cube, the most guys you can hit would probably be these two here, clustered together. Otherwise, everyone else is just a one hit. They're too far spread out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Meaning it's not a radial thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, like a (explosion noise). Oh, cool! Got it. Then I'll take those two dudes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you shift through over here, beneath the ground.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's so cool.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (thudding noises) Underground!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Look how much bigger she is than those fucks!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's not a great roll, but it'll do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you get to reroll ones?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ones and twos.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a 13 and a 17. So neither of them make their save.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So that is 16 times two, so 32 damage to both of them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 32 points of damage to both of them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did they make saves?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So they get pushed as well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And they also get pushed ten feet. Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They stay put.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you watch as rock and dirt is thrown from this wall. Poor Trinket is spattered with rock and dirt and spins around (bear growling).

lines.name: LAURA

lines.text: That wall is not looking very sturdy right now. The Thunderwave has structurally damaged this whole portion of the cavern right now.

lines.text: Thanks, Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This whole thing was coming apart!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends Keyleth's turn. Pike's up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What about between Grog and Scanlan? That way if one of them comes up by either of them, she's there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Get Trinket away from that wall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike's going to run down and stand between Scanlan and Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: "Oh, Grog!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Punch the mace and light that shit up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Blow hair out of her face.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, so she makes this beacon of light.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then she's going to hold her action until a thing appears.
